pageContext.description:
The vertical format with an arched top is divided into two pictorial fields. The essential act takes place within a circle of clouds with winged angels' heads in the upper part of the panel. On the bottom half of the panel there is an ideal landscape with a river and castles. The donor kneels in the foreground on the left wearing a fur-trimmed coat and holding rosary beads while he prays. Behind him is his son. On the right both his wives are depicted in a similar attitude of prayer and between them the donor's daughter.  Those members of the family who were deceased when the epitaph was executed are depicted with a cloth over their mouths. The Assumption and Coronation of the Virgin take place at the same time. 
[Schottke, Exhib. Cat. Leipzig, Heidelberg 1997, 70]
Epitaph for Els († 1514) and Hans Warmuth († 1525), depicted as donors with their family, their names and dates of death are recorded in the inscription below.
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of suport: 200 x 117 cm
[Schottke, Exhib. Cat. Leipzig, Heidelberg 1997, 70]
pageContext.inscription:
- below:
'Noch Christi geburt. 1514. Jar am dag Corp` cristi ist vorschyden mein elich gemahel elß/ warmüthin der got genedig sey. Dar noch als ma schreib. 1525. Am Sontag noch Simo und /Jüdeist vorschyde der ersam hans warmüth dem got genedig und barmherzig sey amen.'
